newsitem.title: USA: BRENT CRUDE CLIMBS IN THIN U.S. AFTERMARKET.
newsitem.headline: BRENT CRUDE CLIMBS IN THIN U.S. AFTERMARKET.

text.p: North Sea Brent crude oil climbed in the U.S. aftermarket on Friday, although activity was exceptionally light.
Two exchange-for-physical deals were transacted at $18.52 for a total of 150 lots, putting cash Brent at $18.55-58 a barrel, factoring in the EFP premium of around four cents a barrel.
London's IPE closed at $18.49 for September.
No intermonths traded. September/October was talked at minus 18/17 cents a barrel, while October/November was pegged at minus 17/14 cents a barrel.
